question:
If a plant is watered adequately, then it will grow well.
Which one of the following cannot be true?
options: A plant that did not grow well was not watered adequately.
A plant that was not watered adequately grew well.
A plant that grew well was watered adequately.
Both B and C

question:
If an employee achieves their targets, then they receive a bonus.
Which one of the following must be true?
options: An employee who did not achieve their targets received a bonus.
An employee who did not receive a bonus achieved their targets.
An employee who did not receive a bonus did not achieve their targets.
An employee who received a bonus did not achieve their targets.

question:
If a car is electric, then it is environmentally friendly.
Which one of the following cannot be false?
options: A car that is not electric is environmentally friendly.
A car that is environmentally friendly is electric.
A car that is not environmentally friendly is not electric.
An electric car is not environmentally friendly.

question:
If the weather is cold, then the heater is on.
Which one of the following must be true?
options: The weather is not cold and the heater is on.
The heater is on so the weather must be cold.
The weather is cold so the heater must be off.
The heater is off so the weather is not cold.

question:
If a document is confidential, then it is locked in the safe.
Which one of the following cannot be false?
options: A document that is not confidential is not in the safe.
A document that is not locked in the safe is not confidential.
A document that is not in the safe is confidential.
A document in the safe is confidential.

question:
If a student studies diligently, then they pass the exam.
Which one of the following must be true?
options: A student who did not study diligently passed the exam.
A student who passed the exam studied diligently.
A student who studied diligently did not pass the exam.
A student who did not pass the exam is the one who did not study diligently.

question:
If a light is red, then cars must stop.
Which one of the following cannot be true?
options: Cars does not stop, then the light is not red.
If a light is red, then cars must stop.
The car stops, then the light is red.
None of the above
